problem_statement: Noticed repeated expensive API calls during performance review of the user profile service. The get_user_profile function in profile_service.py makes external API calls averaging 2.3 seconds each, but 78% of calls within any 5-minute window request the same user IDs. Current implementation has no caching. Need to implement the lru_cache_with_ttl decorator that caches function results based on arguments, evicts least-recently-used entries when capacity is reached, and automatically expires entries after configurable TTL. Cache must be thread-safe for concurrent request handling, support cache statistics for monitoring, and work with any function signature including *args and **kwargs.
